fr.sii.ogham.core.util

Class HtmlUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.util.HtmlUtils

  • public final class HtmlUtils
extends Object
    Utility class for handling HTML content. It helps for repetitive tasks for manipulating HTML.

    • Field Detail

      • CSS_IMAGE_PROPERTIES_PATTERN

        public static final Pattern CSS_IMAGE_PROPERTIES_PATTERN
        Regular expression that matches CSS properties for image inclusions such as:
        • background: <value>;
        • background-image: <value>;
        • list-style: <value>;
        • list-style-image: <value>;
        • cursor: <value>;

        The pattern provides the following named capturing groups:

        • "property": matches the property part (property name, spaces and :)
        • "propertyname": matches the property name (such as background)
        • "value": matches the property value (without final ;)

    • Method Detail

      • isHtml

        public static boolean isHtml(String content)
        Indicates if the provided content is HTML or not. It is considered HTML only if it is a whole document. Any partial HTML content won't be considered as HTML.
        Parameters:
        content - the content to test
        Returns:
        true if it is HTML, false otherwise

      • getDistinctCssUrls

        public static List<String> getDistinctCssUrls(String htmlContent)
        Finds all CSS file inclusions (looks for link tags for stylesheet files). Returns only the path or URL to the CSS file. If the several CSS inclusions have the same path, the path is present in the list only one time.
        Parameters:
        htmlContent - the html content that may contain external CSS files
        Returns:
        the list of found CSS inclusions (paths only) or empty if nothing found

      • getDistinctImageUrls

        public static List<String> getDistinctImageUrls(String htmlContent)
        Finds all image inclusions (looks for img tags). Returns only the path or URL to the image. If the several images have the same path, the path is present in the list only one time.
        Parameters:
        htmlContent - the html content that may contain image files
        Returns:
        the list of found images (paths only) or empty if nothing found

      • getDistinctCssImageUrls

        public static List<String> getDistinctCssImageUrls(String htmlContent)
        Finds all image inclusions from CSS properties. Returns only the path or URL to the image. If the several images have the same path, the path is present in the list only one time.

        It looks for:

        • background
        • background-image
        • list-style
        • list-style-image
        • cursor
        Parameters:
        htmlContent - the html content that may contain image files
        Returns:
        the list of found images (paths only) or empty if nothing found

      • getCssUrlFunctions

        public static List<CssUrlFunction> getCssUrlFunctions(String cssPropertyValue,
                                                      String... additionalEnclosingQuotes)
        Parse the CSS property value that may contain one or several url() CSS function(s). Each element of the returned list provides the following information:
        • "source": the whole match of the url() function
        • "start": matches the url( part (without quote, spaces are preserved)
        • "end": matches the ) part (without quote, spaces are preserved)
        • "url": the url (without surrounding quotes)
        • "enclosingQuoteChar": either " character, ' character or empty string
        WARNING: This function doesn't attempt to validate the URL at all. It just extracts the different parts for later parsing. If either the URL or CSS property value or the url() function is invalid, it may still return a value because it depends on the parsing context. It may then return an invalid form. For example url('images/h'1.gif') is not valid due to unscaped single quote, however this method will return a result with images/h'1.gif as URL.
        Parameters:
        cssPropertyValue - the value of the CSS property
        additionalEnclosingQuotes - allow additional forms such as url(&quot;http://some-url&quot;) that may be used in style attribute
        Returns:
        the list of meta information about the matched urls

      • getTitle

        public static String getTitle(String htmlContent)
        Get the title of the HTML. If no title tag exists, then the title is null.
        Parameters:
        htmlContent - the HTML content that may contain a title
        Returns:
        the title of the HTML or null if none

      • skipExternalUrls

        public static List<String> skipExternalUrls(List<String> urls)
        The list of provided URLs are either relative or absolute. This method returns only the list of relative URLs.

        The URL is considered absolute if it starts with "http://" or https://.

        Parameters:
        urls - the urls (relative or absolute)
        Returns:
        the relative urls only

      • relativize

        public static String relativize(String base,
                                String other)
        Generate a relative URL/path:
        • If other parameter is absolute, then return other.
        • If other parameter is relative, then it merges other into base. For example:
          • base="css/foo.css", other="bar.png" => returns "css/bar.png"
          • base="css/foo.css", other="../images/bar.png" => returns "images/bar.png"
          • base="http://some-url/css/foo.css", other="bar.png" => returns "http://some-url/css/bar.png"
          • base="http://some-url/css/foo.css", other="../images/bar.png" => returns "http://some-url/images/bar.png"

        This method uses isRelativeUrl(String) to determine if other is relative or absolute.

        Parameters:
        base - the base path/URL
        other - the path/URL to relativize
        Returns:
        the merge path/URL

      • isRelativeUrl

        public static boolean isRelativeUrl(String url)
        Indicates if the URL is relative or not.

        Relative URLs may be:

        • "relative/path"
        • "./relative/path"
        • "../relative/path"

        On the contrary, any URL that matches one of the following condition is absolute:

        • starts with a scheme or protocol (like "http://" or "classpath:"
        • starts with a "/"
        Parameters:
        url - the URL that may be relative or absolute
        Returns:
        true if relative
